This questionnaire will ask you about your condition, treatment history, and other information to determine if you are preliminary match to some of the eligibility criteria of one or more AstraZeneca clinical trials. If your responses indicate you might be a potential candidate for a trial, you will have the option to take next steps to get connected to one or more research sites where that trial is taking place.
See the Privacy Notice for more information on how your personal data is handled.
You may either check the acknowledgement box and press Continue, or press Cancel
Use of cookies on this website.
This website provided by Carebox (on behalf of AstraZeneca) uses cookies. We use four types of cookies:
Necessary cookies enable core functionality of the website. You will not be able to use this website without consenting to the use of Necessary cookies.
Preferences cookies are used to personalize content and to provide social media features.
Statistics cookies are used to analyze website traffic and help us improve it.
Marketing cookies are used to track visitors across websites for use by ad agencies.
You can learn more about who we are, how you can contact us, how we process personal data, and our approach to cookies in our Cookie Notice
You can also refer to the Details
and About tabs for more information.

Cookies are small text files that can be used by websites to make a user's experience more efficient. Some cookies are considered necessary in order for us to provide our service to you. For other types of cookies we need your permission.
This site uses different types of cookies. Some cookies are placed by third party services that appear on our pages.
You can learn more about who we are, how you can contact us, how we process personal data, and our approach to cookies in our Cookie Notice
You can also refer to the Details tab for more information.

You can at any time change or withdraw your consent for the use of cookies for all cookies (other than necessary cookies, as described below) on our website using the Cookies button in the footer of every page.

trans-unit.source: Necessary cookies help make a website usable by enabling basic functions like page navigation and access to secure areas of the website. The website cannot function properly without these cookies. You can set your browser to block these cookies, but then you might not be able to proceed with your intended interactions or otherwise receive the full benefit of our website.
Security token required to maintain a coherent web session experience across pages
Preference cookies enable a website to remember information that changes the way the website behaves or looks, like your preferred language or the region that you are in.
Persists previously selected cookie settings across multiple visits to the website
depends on Preferences toggle - ON: 1 year, OFF: Session
Statistic cookies help website owners to understand how visitors interact with websites by collecting and reporting information anonymously.
The main cookie used by Google Analytics to capture website usage statistics.
Used by Google Analytics to collect data on the number of times a user has visited the website as well as dates for the first and most recent visit.

Marketing cookies are used to track visitors across websites. The intention is to display ads that are relevant and engaging for the individual user and thereby more valuable for publishers and third-party advertisers.

When this toggle is turned on, you will only see verified trials. Verified trials are sponsored by companies that are customers of Carebox and assist in verifying the trial information and matching criteria.

To include home-based trials in your results, click the toggle to turn it off. Home-based (or decentralized) trials are studies where some or all of a clinical trial's activities occur at locations other than a traditional clinical trial site, such as the participant's home. These trials aim to shift toward a more patient-centric research approach by enhancing accessibility, inclusivity, and comfort.

When this toggle is turned on, you will only see trials that are a preliminary match based on your questionnaire responses. The toggle will be disabled if you do not have a completed questionnaire or if there are no matching trials to your questionnaire being shown, based on your selected condition and/or filters.
Begin Typing a Condition, Trial Name, or Drug

This website uses cookies and other technologies to personalize content and ads on this and other websites and provide social media features. By clicking I Agree you consent to our use of tracking technologies and disclosure of tracking data to third party ad networks or social media companies for the purposes above. If you click "I Disagree" you can still use this website. For more information about Lillys privacy practice and to manage third-party preferences, click here.

When you visit any web site, it may store or retrieve information on your browser, mostly in the form of cookies. This information might be about you, your preferences or your device and is mostly used to make the site work as you expect it to. Cookies can be used to distinguish you from other users of this website.

Because we respect your right to privacy, you can choose not to allow some types of cookies. Click on the different category headings to find out more and change our default settings. However, blocking some types of cookies may impact your experience of the site and the services we are able to offer. Para obtener ms informacin, consulte nuestra poltica de cookies y nuestra poltica de privacidad o poltica de privacidad para profesionales sanitarios.

Because we respect your right to privacy, you can choose not to allow some types of cookies. Click on the different category headings to find out more and change our default settings. However, blocking some types of cookies may impact your experience of the site and the services we are able to offer. For further information, you can consult our Privacy Statement.

These cookies and other technologies are essential to make the website usable by enabling basic functions such as page navigation and access to secure areas of the website. You are not able to opt-out of any cookies or other technologies that are strictly necessary for the service.
These cookies are necessary for website functions such as setting your privacy preferences, logging in or completing forms. By using this site, you agree we may place these cookies on your device.
These cookies and other technologies collect information about how users interact with the Services and allow us to improve how they work.
These cookies and other technologies collect information about how users interact with the Services and allow us to improve how they work.
These cookies are used to monitor traffic and analyze trends for how visitors browse our website.
These cookies are used to monitor traffic and analyze trends for how visitors browse our website.
These cookies are used to monitor traffic and analyze trends for how visitors browse our website.
Lilly collects information about your online interactions, such as user ID, browsing history, geolocation and IP address, through tracking technologies, such as third-party cookies.

You may accept, decline or withdraw your consent to most cookies and tracking technologies on this site, other than those that are necessary for the site operations and functionality, by clicking one of the options below. We use this information to personalize content, save your preferences, and track website performance. We share information with our analytics, marketing, and advertising partners for purposes of targeted advertising and analyzing website metrics. Please visit our Cookie Notice, Privacy Statement, and Consumer Health Privacy Notice for more information. Certain laws require consent to collect and share information. You can withdraw your consent at any time through the Cookie Settings or Your Privacy Choices in our website footer.
Users located in Washington or Nevada must use this link to Decline All
For more information about Lilly's cookies, tracking technologies and third-party cookies, see our Cookie Notice.

These cookies are necessary for the website to function properly and cannot be switched off in our systems. Strictly necessary cookies cannot be disabled. For example, these cookies may enable us to optimize page and content loading, distribute and manage site traffic, detect bugs and errors and block malicious traffic and suspicious activity. In addition, these cookies may enable third party-supported features that you use, such as video players and chat tools, and other key site functionality, such as webforms.

These cookies and similar technologies remember choices you make such as language or search parameters. We use these cookies to improve your user experience and to make your use of the websites more tailored. If you do not allow these cookies, then some or all of these services may not function as designed.

These cookies allow Lilly to analyze visits and traffic sources so we can measure and improve the performance of our sites. They help us to know which pages are the most and least popular, and see how visitors move around the site to improve the site's performance.

These cookies and similar technologies enable our advertising and marketing partners to provide behavioral advertising and use functionalities like social media pixels to track your online activity across social platforms and websites, which can identify you, as described in the Privacy Statement and Consumer Health Privacy Notice. These methods create a profile of your activity for our business and commercial purposes and enable Lilly and our advertising partners to customize offers and information (online or in person) to you based on your profile, and profiles of persons with similar interests, that may enhance your interactions with Lilly.

Begin typing characters in the box below and then select a matching NCT ID from the list shown

At Lilly, we're committed to making life better for patients. One way we do this is by conducting clinical trials to test new medicines. Each trial relies on trial volunteers to take part, and we're incredibly grateful for your help. That's why we believe in transparency.

Put simply, we want our trial volunteers, the public, and the wider healthcare community to easily access information about past Lilly trials. This information can potentially help people make decisions about their health.
The results of a research trial may not be available right away. Sometimes, it can take up to a year after the study has ended. Check back later if results for your study are not listed.

Your Lilly Trial Match Results are Ready

Before viewing the match results, it is very helpful to enter the location of the patient. This will display the distance to the nearest site for each trial, and sort the results based on that distance.

Clinical trial matches are found by comparing the answers you provided with some of the eligibility criteria of currently enrolling Lilly studies. Only the clinical trial site staff can determine if you are eligible to enroll, and they may ask you additional questions.
Completing the Trial Match questionnaire doesnt mean that you will be enrolled in a study. There may be more eligibility criteria for the study which are assessed by the Lilly clinical team.
Complete a Lilly Trial Match questionnaire to find out which clinical trials may be a good fit for you, or a loved one.

When you press Start Lilly Trial Match, you will answer questions about relevant medical conditions and treatment history. The answers will be compared to some of the key criteria for trials, called inclusion and exclusion criteria.
If your responses show that a trial may be a good fit, you can:
Select which clinical trial site works best for you.
Share your details and questionnaire directly with site(s) that allow this.
Get details for the site(s) of your choice.
Answer a few questions to find which Lilly trials may be the best fit for you or your loved one.

When you press Start Questionnaire, you will be presented with a few questions about your or the patients condition and treatment history. Your answers to the questionnaire will then be compared to the eligibility criteria also called inclusion and exclusion criteria for clinical trials, and you will see whether you are a preliminary match for any of these studies.

Please note that completing the questionnaire and being identified as a preliminary match does not necessarily mean that you can participate. There may be additional eligibility requirements and only an approved Lilly clinical trial site can determine whether you or the patient may qualify.
(No Locations With Coordinates for this Trial)
Only Show Locations with Study Questionnaire

Clinical trials have inclusion and exclusion requirements to determine which individuals qualify for participation. Listed below are key requirements for this clinical trial, but there may be additional requirements to qualify.
The clinical trial requested is not available on this website. Please click Continue to view and search the list of trials available.
The 'condition' is the disease, disorder, syndrome, illness, or injury that is being looked at in this study.
Clinical studies are done to test new drugs, devices, or procedures to see if they work and are safe.

A placebo is a fake drug sometimes used in studies to help see if the real drug works and is safe. There is a chance, like the toss of a coin, that you may get a placebo. Neither you nor your doctor can choose if you get a drug or a placebo.
The enrollment goal is the number of patients needed to enroll (or take part) in this study.
These dates show how long this study could last.
How long will I be in the trial?

Clinical studies are done in different phases. Phase 1 studies are done in a small group of healthy people to see if a new drug is safe. Phase 2, 3, and 4 studies are done in larger groups of patients who have the disease or condition being looked at to see how well it works and to get more safety information.

Thank You For Sharing Your Details

Once the clinical research study site has received your information, they will review it and typically reach out within 3 business days. In some cases, they may not reach out. Reasons for this can include if the study is full, or if study criteria change.
If the study site has not contacted you within 3 business days and you want to contact them, you can use the following details:
Thank you for completing the questionnaire. If you would like to learn more about this area of research, you can

A CTM study nurse will be in touch with you shortly regarding next steps in verifying qualification for participation, answering your questions, and if eligible for further screening, getting you connected with a nearby trial site.
If you are in the United States, there is no need to select a clinical trial site. Just
to answer the study questionnaire and, if you are a preliminary fit, a study nurse will be in touch for next steps.
If you are interested in a site outside of the United States, please select your country and enter your location to identify a potentially relevant clinical trial site that you can reach out to.
This Trial is Not a Match
Based on your questionnaire responses, you do not meet the key criteria for this clinical trial.
Based on the data you provided it looks like you have already submitted a request to take the next steps.
You can sign up for Lilly Trial Alerts. When clinical trials that may be a good fit are looking for participants, we will send you an email.
This Clinical Trial May Be a Good Fit

You meet some of the key criteria for this clinical trial. This means you can share your details with the trial site via OneStudyTeam, a Lilly trial enrollment partner. Please enter your contact details below and click Submit. Your details and questionnaire responses will then be shared with OneStudyTeam and the trial site.

You meet some of the key criteria for this clinical trial. This means you can be connected to a study nurse that will assist you in further assessing your fit for this trial. Please enter your contact details below and click Submit. Your details and questionnaire responses will then be shared with Clinical Trial Media (CTM). If youre eligible for further screening, the study nurse will help you select and get connected to nearby trial site for next steps.

You meet some of the key criteria for this clinical trial. This means you can share your details with the study site. Please enter your contact details below and click Submit. Your details and Lilly Trial Match questionnaire responses will be shared with the study site as the next step.
A valid phone number is required

By checking this box, I understand that my contact details and questionnaire responses will be shared with OneStudyTeam and by them with the trial site. I understand this action does not mean that I am enrolled in the clinical trial and further screening will be necessary to determine eligibility.

By checking this box, I understand that my contact details and questionnaire responses will be shared with Clinical Trial Media (CTM) and they will be in touch with me regarding next steps. I understand this action does not mean that I am enrolled in the clinical trial and further screening will be necessary to determine eligibility.

By checking this box, I am permitting Carebox to share my contact details and Lilly Trial Match questionnaire responses with my chosen study site. I understand this action does not mean that I am enrolled in the clinical trial, and further screening will be necessary to determine eligibility.

Complete the study questionnaire: This will allow you to see if you may potentially qualify for the clinical research study. Some of the answers may be prefilled based on your Lilly Trial Match questionnaire. Please check these are still correct before you submit the questionnaire. If you may qualify based on your answers you will be asked to submit your contact details.
By clicking "Start Study Questionnaire" to see if you may qualify, you agree to share your Lilly Trial Match results (if already provided) with Reify, who hosts the study specific questionnaire.
Lilly Trial Match does not include any identifiable information sharing.
An additional consent may be required if the results of your questionnaire prompt you for contact information to connect with the Lilly study site you have chosen.
Select your country and enter your location to find the closest clinical trial site(s) to you.
Or you can use the map to find clinical trial sites looking for participants.
Once you have chosen your site, click the take the next step button on the map or the
icon in the table and we will walk you through the next steps.
Clinical trial sites receive potential participant information in different way. You may have the option to call the site or share your questionnaire and your contact details with the site.

Clinical trial sites receive potential participant information in different way. You may have the option to call the site or share your questionnaire and your contact details with the site. Before you can do so, you must first
to check if this clinical trial may be a good fit for you

See if You May Qualify: Complete a short questionnaire. Answering the questions doesn't mean that you are enrolled in a study, but it is the first step. The site will reach out to you if you provided contact details and if the answers mean you may qualify for the research study.

You meet some of the key criteria for this study. Please click Take the Next Step and choose the study site that works best for you.

This study is part of a program of inflammatory bowel disease studies, with each one having its own requirements to participate. The questionnaire below will be used to prescreen you for all available studies. Your answers will determine if you are eligible for further screening for one of these studies.

This program of studies is evaluating how safe an investigational medicine is and how effective it is in helping people with excess weight manage their weight and other chronic health issues. Each study has its own set of requirements in order to pre-qualify.
